item.title: Markov Chains in Julia
item.author: personal.jnapolitano@gmail.com (Justin Napolitano)
item.description: Introduction I am currently working on a legal research series where I perform statistical analysis and ml models to legal datasets. My intention is to model the behavior of courts, determine the outcome of cases, and build a pipeline capable of identifying relevant case law by issue area. That data set is nearly complete, but I have not decided which models to apply to it. This is where Julia comes into play.

item.title: Quantitative Julia Problems
item.author: personal.jnapolitano@gmail.com (Justin Napolitano)
item.description: Introduction In my previous post, I demonstrated how to configure Rocky Linux and RHEL distributions for quantitative analysis. In this post, I include a few sample programs to test your installation. How to run the programs I saved them to a folder within the project directory. Activate the Project using Pkg Pkg.activate(".") #cd("<sub-directory-containing-files>) optional Run a program include("path/to/script-name.jl") Estimate the Value of Pi Use the Monte Carlo method to estimate the value of pi.
